Now, because of a benign biopsy but with hyperplasia--he wants me to have a screening MRI next appt. But, he wants me to take 20 days of tamoxifen before, to blunt the MRI from lighting up all over the place. My question is about the 3 weeks of tamoxifen. I've read how it is a dangerous drug, and can cause stroke, joint pain, and other menopausal symptoms.... Right now, I'm in a miserable perimenopause with palpitations, dryness, headaches, hair thinning you name it, and I'm worried that the 20 days of tamoxifen will make everything worse, and the effects of the drug could linger. When my estrogen dips, it's hell on earth. I have an extreme sensitivity to the changing hormones. Let me know if you had to take this for the MRI, or took a short course of this and what happened?
